Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a fish and may partially label the fish correctly.
The student can draw and label water to show a basic understanding of the water environment where fish live.
The student can depict some plants or animals in the habitat, possibly only labeling them generically.
CANNOT: The student cannot consistently show or label how fish use water to swim and survive (student might not include movement indicators, like fins or waves).
The student cannot clearly illustrate the relationship between fish and necessary resources such as food (student might omit or incorrectly label food sources).
The student cannot accurately depict how the habitat is part of a system that meets the fish's needs (student may not show connections between habitat elements, like sunlight for plants).
